g.text: Shown is a graph of the global average temperature
(b) The year when the average temperature was 14.2°C
(c) The year when the temperature was smallest? Largest?
Trees grow faster and form wider rings in warm years and
grow more slowly and form narrower rings in cooler years. The
Igure shows ring widths of a Siberian pine from 1500 to 2000.
(a) What is the range of the ring width function?
What does the graph tend to say about the temperature
of the earth? Does the graph re²ect the volcanic erup-
Adapted from G. Jacoby et al., “Mongolian Tree Rings and 20th-
You put some ice cubes in a glass, ±ll the glass with cold water,
and then let the glass sit on a table. Describe how the tempera-
ture of the water changes as time passes. Then sketch a rough
graph of the temperature of the water as a function of the
Three runners compete in a 100-meter race. The graph
depicts the distance run as a function of time for each runner.
Describe in words what the graph tells you about this race.
Who won the race? Did each runner ±nish the race?
The graph shows the power consumption for a day in Septem-
sured in hours starting at midnight.)
When was the power consumption the lowest? When was
it the highest? Do these times seem reasonable?
Sketch a rough graph of the number of hours of daylight as a
function of the time of year.
Sketch a rough graph of the outdoor temperature as a function
of time during a typical spring day.
Sketch a rough graph of the market value of a new car as a
function of time for a period of 20 years. ±ssume the car is
Sketch the graph of the amount of a particular brand of coffee
sold by a store as a function of the price of the coffee.
You place a frozen pie in an oven and bake it for an hour.
Then you take it out and let it cool before eating it. Describe
how the temperature of the pie changes as time passes.
Then sketch a rough graph of the temperature of the pie as a
± homeowner mows the lawn every Wednesday afternoon.
Sketch a rough graph of the height of the grass as a function
of time over the course of a four-week period.
±n airplane takes off from an airport and lands an hour later
at another airport, 400 miles away. If
minutes since the plane has left the terminal building, let
be the horizontal distance traveled and
